key_points: Americans have received over $850 billion from three stimulus packages due to COVID-19.
75% of recipients used the first stimulus check for household expenses amidst the April 2020 unemployment spike.
Spending patterns shifted in the second and third checks, with more saving and debt payment than essential spending.
Second Stimulus Check: Spend (22%), Save (26%), Pay Debt (51%)
Third Stimulus Check: Spend (19%), Save (32%), Pay Debt (49%)
Stimulus checks targeted low and middle income households, with a decline in benefits for those earning over $75,000.
High-income households were more likely to save or pay off debt with their stimulus checks.
Economic Impact Payments may have contributed to increases in personal income, consumer spending, savings, and economic growth.
A fourth stimulus check is unlikely, with President Biden focusing on a new infrastructure package instead.
More than 80 members of Congress support $2,000 monthly checks until the end of the pandemic, but lack significant support.
